ARABIC: بِسْمِ ٱللَّهِ ٱلرَّحْمَٰنِ ٱلرَّحِيمِ وَٱلْمُرْسَلَٰتِ عُرْفًا

ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_0: By those sent forth in succession,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_1: I CALL TO WITNESS those who are sent consecutively,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_2: By the (winds) sent forth in quick succession,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_3: By (the angels) sent forth with the commands of God,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_4: By oath of those that are sent, one after the other. (The verses of the Holy Qur’an or the angels or the winds).
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_6: I swear by the emissary winds, sent one after another (for men's benefit),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_8: By the emissary winds, (sent) one after another
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_9: By the winds sent forth in swift succession,
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_10: By the winds sent forth with beneficence.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_12: By the (Winds) sent forth one after another (to man's profit);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_13: By the winds (or angels or the Messengers of Allah) sent forth one after another.
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_14: By (the wind) those sent (as horses') mane (in succession),
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_16: By those [winds] sent forth in gusts
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_17: [77:1] By those sent in succession (‘urfan), that is, [by] the winds that follow [one another] in succession, like the mane (‘urf) of a horse, one part [of hair] coming after the other (‘urfan is in the accusative because it is a circumstantial qualifier);
ENGLISH.TRANSLATION_18: And from his narration on the authority of Ibn 'Abbas that he said concerning the interpretation of Allah's saying (By the emissaries, (sent) one after another): '(By the emissaries, (sent) one after another) He says: Allah swears by the many angels who are sent one after another, just like horses follow one another; it is also said that these are the angels who are sent with the good, i.e. Gabriel, Michael and Seraphiel.
